awd_titl_txt: In Situ Measurement of Oxygen Consumption by Gelatinous     Zooplankton
awd_abstract_narration: The resolution of structure and function within pelagic food webs               requires the use of appropriate techniques and equipment.                       Gelatinous zooplankton are targeted in this proposal as they                    represent a poorly studied but ecologically important fauna                     throughout the oceanic water column. Due to their delicate                      nature, the metabolism of most soft-bodied zooplankton can only                 be investigated in their natural environment and it is                          hypothesized that in situ measurements of oxygen consumption will               lead to reduced errors associated with animal handling, pressure                and temperature changes, and light shock.  Data obtained in situ                will be used to quantify the contribution of gelatinous                         zooplankton to the energetics of midwater communities.                          Furthermore, comparisons of this information with similar                       metabolic data on crustaceans and fishes will provide an                        important counterpoint and permit a better understanding of                     selective pressures in the deep sea.
